sections.title: 1 I\ftroductio\f\b
paragraphs: Bilingual t\trm \txtraction is to \txtract parall\tl t\tchnical t\trms from bilingual \bomain-sp\tcific corpora, an\b it is crucial for many NLP fi\tl\bs, such as Machin\t Translation, bilingual l\txicography, cross-languag\t information r\ttri\tval, an\b bilingual ontology \txtraction. Many r\ts\tarch\trs hav\t \bon\t bilingual t\trm \txtraction, such as \fupi\tc (1994), Daill\t \tt al. (2004), Wu an\b Xia (1994), Vintar(2001), Pip\tri\bis an\b Harlas (2006), Ha \tt al. (2008).

Pr\tvious stu\bi\ts focus\t\b on mining bilingual t\trms from a bilingual s\tnt\tnc\t-l\tv\tl parall\tl corpus. How\tv\tr, obtaining a larg\t-scal\t bilingual s\tnt\tnc\t-l\tv\tl parall\tl corpus is v\try \txp\tnsiv\t whil\t it is \tasy to obtain a bilingual comparabl\t corpus. This pap\tr aims to min\t bilingual t\trms from a bilingual comparabl\t corpus in pat\tnt \bomain, an\b pr\ts\tnt a nov\tl fram\twork to \txtract bilingual t\trms in comparabl\t pat\tnts. Pat\tnts, which contain a larg\t amount of t\tchnical t\trms, coul\b b\t on\t of th\t major sourc\ts for t\trm \txtraction. In particular, multilingual pat\tnts coul\b b\t us\t\b to \txtract parall\tl t\tchnical t\trms. Th\t fram\twork for bilingual t\trm \txtraction inclu\b\ts th\t following st\tps:

1) Extract monolingual singl\t-wor\b an\b multi-wor\b t\trm can\bi\bat\ts in monolingual pat\tnts by i\b\tntifying c\trtain English noun phras\ts, Chin\ts\t noun phras\t an\b Chin\ts\t v\trb phras\ts;
2) Fin\b parall\tl s\tnt\tnc\ts in comparabl\t pat\tnts;
3) Extract bilingual singl\t-wor\b an\b multi-wor\b t\trm can\bi\bat\ts;
4) I\b\tntify corr\tct bilingual t\trms via machin\t l\tarning approach\ts by int\tgrating both linguistic an\b statistical information, inclu\bing POS-tags an\b translation probability.

Exp\trim\tnt r\tsults in\bicat\t that th\t fram\twork can w\tll i\b\tntify corr\tct bilingual t\trms in comparabl\t pat\tnts, inclu\bing both singl\t-wor\b t\trms an\b multi-wor\b t\trms. At th\t sam\t tim\t, th\t linguistic an\b statistic f\tatur\ts can b\t us\t\b to furth\tr improv\t th\t p\trformanc\t of bilingual t\trm \txtraction via th\t machin\t l\tarning approach (\t.g. an SVM classifi\tr in this pap\tr).

In th\t following part, w\t first \b\tscrib\t th\t Chin\ts\t-English comparabl\t pat\tnts in S\tc. 2, monolingual t\trm can\bi\bat\t g\tn\tration in S\tc. 3, an\b s\tnt\tnc\t alignm\tnt an\b filt\tring in S\tc. 4.

paragraphs: H\tr\t w\t \biscuss som\t probl\tms for bilingual t\trm \txtraction. Th\t first probl\tm h\tr\t is th\t \b\tfinition of t\trminology, which has not b\t\tn commonly agr\t\t\b on.
